elements.title: US$10,000 bill (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the US$10,000 bill (example pictured) is the highest denomination of US currency that has been used by the public?

elements.title: political text messages (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Americans received nearly 15 billion political text messages in 2022?

elements.title: The Book of Longings (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that novelist Sue Monk Kidd spent fourteen months researching New Testament–era Egypt and the Levant for The Book of Longings?

elements.title: Jools Lebron (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that following the success of Jools Lebron's "demure" videos, she stated that she was able to use the proceeds to pay for her gender transition?

elements.title: statue of John Stockton (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that, when preparing the statue of John Stockton, its sculptor repositioned the model about 20 times by using a wrench to adjust ball-and-socket joints on steel rods?

elements.title: liberalism in the Philippines (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the writings of José Rizal, a prominent contributor to liberalism in the Philippines, were adopted by both Philippine independence fighters and American colonial authorities?

elements.title: White Noise (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Will Wood conducted a Bulgarian choir via Zoom for "White Noise"?

elements.title: Xiphophorus signum (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Xiphophorus signum is the only swordtail not known to hybridise with other species?

elements.title: Mr. Bronx (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Mr. Bronx was not from the Bronx?
